Dialog.AllContents1: This will process all player characters in the world.
Dialog.SingleContents1: This will process only this character
Dialog.Contents2: The process will create coin items in the actor's inventory and then update the coins or currency based on which behaviour you select below.
Dialog.Contents3: Preserving currency will ensure total currency of the character remains the same and will set coin numbers that equal that amount. This will recalculate and stomp over existing coin counts if the character already has coins.
Dialog.Contents4: Preserving coin counts will leave the existing coins in the character's inventory untouched and will set the currency to the total value of said coins. If a character has no coins, this will set the currency to 0.
Dialog.Contents5: If this is your first time running this process, you should use the preserve currency option.
Dialog.Contents6: If your world has characters with coins already, you should use the preserve coins option.
Dialog.Contents7: This process can not be undone. Are you sure you would like to continue?
Dialog.Contents8: For more information, visit the SFC project page.

BehaviourOptions.KeepCurrencyTitle: Generates coin quantities based on currency
BehaviourOptions.KeepCoinsTitle: Calculates the currency based on existing coins

Dialog.RefreshDataContent:
Changes were made to one or more coins.

Would you like to update existing coins on characters?

(This will not apply value changes. You must still run a full initialize if you made changes to coin values.)
Dialog.ValueChangedContent:
You have changed one or more coin values and you have characters with coins in your world.

You must reinitialize those characters after doing this.

CoinManager.Name: Coin Manager
CoinManager.AddDescription: When adding currency, higher value coins will be added first. When adding coins, the number of each coin entered will be added.
CoinManager.RemoveDescription: When removing with either method, the lowest value coins will be removed first, converting higher value coins into smaller value coins as necessary.
CoinManager.AddRemoveWarning: Warning: If your coin values do not evenly divide into each other or if you try to remove an amount that does not evenly divide into your coin values, the remainders will be lost.
CoinManager.ExchangeAllDescription: Exchange All will reduce the character's coins to the minimum number while retaining value e.g. 650 copper becomes 6 gold and 5 silver.
CoinManager.ExchangeDescription: Exchange will attempt to convert the entered amount of coins from the first type to the second.
